title: String and force censor attached to cart

content.question: A cart of known mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is initially at rest on a straight horizontal track, and a force sensor attached to a string is used to pull on the cart. The wheels of the cart have negligible mass and negligible internal friction. Which of the following indicates how a graph of the force sensor reading as a function of time can be used to estimate the final speed of the cart?

choices.label: By multiplying the area under the graph by <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
By dividing the area under the graph by <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
By multiplying the slope of the graph by <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
By dividing the slope of the graph by <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: By dividing the area under the graph by <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
